Article Title: Apple confirms ChatGPT integration for iOS 18 coming later this year
Article Text:
ChatGPT coming to iOS 18

Apple CEO Tim Cook has reaffirmed the company’s commitment to integrating ChatGPT into its iOS 18 operating system, confirming the feature is on track for a later this year release.The announcement came during Apple’s quarterly earnings call, where Cook addressed questions about the progress of Apple Intelligence, the company’s umbrella term for AI features .Cook confirmed that ChatGPT integration will be available by the end of the year as part of Apple Intelligence.First unveiled at WWDC in June, the ChatGPT integration is expected to significantly enhance Siri’s capabilities, allowing for more natural and informative interactions. Beyond Siri, Apple Intelligence is poised to offer a range of features, including text summarisation, improved notification management, and even custom emoji generation.With user consent, Siri will be able to provide ChatGPT-powered answers to questions and requests. ChatGPT will also be integrated into Apple's writing tools, enabling users to generate text and images. Apple has confirmed that its ChatGPT implementation will utilise OpenAI 's advanced GPT-4o model.iPhone, iPad, and Mac users will enjoy free access to ChatGPT without needing to create an account. ChatGPT Plus subscribers can link their accounts for premium features on these devices. Apple has assured users that ChatGPT requests and IP addresses will not be stored by OpenAI.While the exact timeline for the iOS 18 release remains unconfirmed, Cook’s statement indicates that users can anticipate experiencing the benefits of ChatGPT integration before the year ends.
Article Summary: ChatGPT will be integrated into Apple's iOS 18 operating system. Apple has confirmed that its ChatGPT implementation will utilise OpenAI's advanced GPT-4o model. iPhone, iPad, and Mac users will enjoy free access to Chat GPT without needing to create an account. ChatG PT Plus subscribers can link their accounts for premium features.

Article Title: Government has a warning for SBI customers on this 'alert message' from the bank
Article Text:
What is the message

Here are some tips to protect yourself from

SMS fraud

:

Avoid clicking links or providing personal information to numbers you don't recognise.

Legitimate businesses rarely demand immediate action via SMS.

Hover over links without clicking to check the actual URL. Avoid clicking if it looks unfamiliar or misspelled.

Avoid sharing passwords, credit card numbers, or personal details via SMS

Enable two-factor authentication: This adds an extra layer of security to your accounts

Be cautious with free Wi-Fi. Public Wi-Fi networks can be less secure, making it easier for hackers to intercept information.

Ensure your phone's operating system and apps are up-to-date with the latest security patches

If you receive a suspicious text, report it immediately

Fact Check Unit of the Press Information Bureau (PIB), under I&B ministry, has alerted SBI customers about fraudulent messages being circulated. In a post on X, formerly known as Twitter, PIB stated that scammers are sending APKs and messages via SMS and WhatsApp, claiming to help redeem SBI reward points. PIB clarified that SBI never sends links or unsolicited APKs through SMS or WhatsApp and advised the bank customers to not to click on such links or download unknown files.“Beware! Did you also receive a message asking you to download & install an APK file to redeem SBI rewards #PIBFactCheck @TheOfficialSBI NEVER sends links or APK files over SMS/WhatsApp Never download unknown files or click on such links,” reads the post.SBI rewards:Dear Value customer,Your SBI NetBanking Reward Points (Rs 9980.00) will expire today! Now Redeem through SBI REWARD App Install & claim your reward by cash deposit in your account.ThankyouTeam-SBI
Article Summary: The Press Information Bureau (PIB), under I&B ministry, has alerted SBI customers about fraudulent messages being circulated. PIB stated that scammers are sending APKs and messages via SMS and WhatsApp, claiming to help redeem SBI reward points.

Article Title: When Elon Musk 'remembered' Genghis Khan for this long post on Telegram CEO Pavel Durov
Article Text: Pavel Durov , the co-founder and CEO of the popular messaging app Telegram, recently disclosed that he has fathered over 100 biological children. Remarkably, he remains unmarried.Durov’s journey as a sperm donor began 15 years ago when a close friend approached him with a heartfelt request. The friend and his wife were struggling with fertility issues, and they asked Durov to donate sperm at a clinic.Initially amused by the idea, Durov soon realized the seriousness of the situation and agreed to help.Doctors emphasized the scarcity of high-quality donor material, prompting Durov to view sperm donation as his civic duty. His contributions have enabled around a hundred couples across 12 countries to conceive children. Even today, one IVF clinic retains his frozen sperm for anonymous use by families seeking to expand.Despite acknowledging the risks involved, Durov has no regrets about his altruistic act. He believes he played a role in addressing the global shortage of healthy sperm.Tesla CEO Elon Musk , himself father of 12 children, playfully responded to Durov’s revelation. On X (formerly Twitter), Musk quipped that having 100 biological children was “rookie numbers,” humorously attributing the quote to Genghis Khan—an 11th-century Mongol ruler estimated to have had hundreds, if not thousands, of biological offspring.Musk himself has fathered 12 children with three different women and recently welcomed a new baby with Neuralink executive Shivon Zilis.
Article Summary: Telegram co-founder Pavel Durov has fathered over 100 biological children. Remarkably, he remains unmarried. His contributions have enabled around a hundred couples across 12 countries to conceive children. Tesla CEO Elon Musk, himself father of 12 children, playfully responded to the revelation.

Article Title: Google Contacts update makes contact syncing easier and displays synced account details
Article Text: Google has announced a significant update to its Contacts service aimed at streamlining contact management and providing users with greater transparency. The new update introduces simplified contact syncing and offers clear insights into where each contact is stored.With the latest update, users can now effortlessly keep their contacts in sync across multiple devices and platforms.Google has refined the syncing process to ensure a seamless experience, eliminating the hassle of managing contacts manually. This is particularly beneficial for users who frequently switch between devices or use a combination of personal and work accounts.One of the standout features of the update is the ability to see synced account details directly within contact cards. This transparency empowers users to quickly identify the source of each contact, whether it's a linked email account or stored locally on the device. This information is crucial for effective contact management and helps users make informed decisions about their contacts.To enhance user security and privacy, Google has also introduced a "Report illegal profile content" button within contact cards. This feature allows users to flag contacts that violate Google's policies, providing an additional layer of protection for user data.The updated Google Contacts is designed to make contact management more efficient and intuitive. By providing clear visibility into contact syncing and ownership, Google aims to simplify the user experience and help people stay connected effortlessly.
Article Summary: Google has announced a significant update to its Contacts service aimed at streamlining contact management and providing users with greater transparency. The new update introduces simplified contact syncing and offers clear insights into where each contact is stored. Google has also introduced a "Report illegal profile content" button within contact cards.

Article Title: What Google's regulatory filing reveals about its stake in CrowdStrike, the company that caused biggest-ever internet outage
Article Text:
Troubles mount for CrowdStrike

Google 's parent company, Alphabet , has significantly reduced its stake in cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike, according to a recent regulatory filing. The move comes amidst a firestorm of controversy surrounding a global tech outage triggered by a CrowdStrike software update last month.Alphabet's holdings in CrowdStrike dropped from 855,789 Class A shares to 427,895 as of June 30th, representing a substantial decrease in its investment.This decision was made prior to the July 19th outage that disrupted operations across industries, including healthcare, banking, and aviation.The widespread disruption caused by the CrowdStrike incident has led to a dramatic decline in the company's stock price, with shares plummeting by nearly 35%. Investors are reevaluating their reliance on single-source cybersecurity solutions, and regulatory scrutiny is intensifying over the safety of such critical software.Adding to CrowdStrike's troubles, a class-action lawsuit was filed against the company this week accusing it of misleading investors about the reliability of its software. Furthermore, Delta Airlines has claimed that the outage cost the company a staggering $500 million, and it is pursuing legal action against both Microsoft and CrowdStrike for damages.As the fallout from the outage continues to unfold, the cybersecurity industry is facing unprecedented challenges. The incident has raised serious questions about the resilience of critical infrastructure and the potential risks associated with overreliance on a single vendor.
Article Summary: Alphabet's holdings in CrowdStrike dropped from 855,789 Class A shares to 427,895 as of June 30th. The decision was made prior to the July 19th outage that disrupted operations across industries, including healthcare, banking, and aviation.

Article Title: Apple beats quarterly revenue record in India, Indonesia and these countries
Article Text:
Cook said Apple “excited about Apple Intelligence”

Apple CEO Tim Cook told investors during the company’s earnings call that the company’s June quarter revenue record is better than it had expected. He said that the company set quarterly revenue records in more than two dozen countries and regions, including India.“Apple is reporting a new June quarter revenue record of $85.8 billion, up 5% from a year ago, and better than we had expected… We also set quarterly revenue records in more than two dozen countries and regions, including Canada, Mexico, France, Germany, the UK, India, Indonesia, the Philippines, and Thailand,” Cook said in the earnings call after the Q3 results were announced.“And we set an all-time revenue record in services, which grew 14%,” he added.Echoing Cook, Luca Maestri , senior vice president and chief financial officer at Apple, said that Mac’s revenue growth is also due to “strong performance in our emerging markets, with June quarter records for Mac in Latin America, India, and South Asia.”Talking about Apple Intelligence – an AI-powered system that includes generative AI models and tools, Cook said that the company remains optimistic about the possibilities of AI.“During the quarter, we were excited to announce incredible updates to our software platforms at our Worldwide Developers Conference, including Apple Intelligence, a breakthrough personal intelligence system that puts powerful, private generative AI models at the core of iPhone, iPad, and Mac,” Cook said.“We very much look forward to sharing these tools with our users, and we continue to invest significantly in the innovations that will enrich our customers’ lives, while leading with the values that drive our work,” he added.“With each innovation, we’re unlocking new ways of working, new ways of learning, and new ways of tapping into the unlimited promise of human potential. We are doing that across every product and every service,” Cook noted.The Apple CEO also explained that Apple Intelligence will be available on “pretty much all of the apps that you use every day”, and “so there is been a deep level of thinking about how it affects those apps”.
Article Summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook said the company’s June quarter revenue record is better than it had expected. He said that the company set quarterly revenue records in more than two dozen countries and regions, including India. Cook said Apple “excited about Apple Intelligence”

Article Title: Intel to layoff over 15,000 employees: Read the memo shared by company’s CEO
Article Text:
Here’s the full text of the memo shared by Intel CEO

Team,

We have moved our All Company Meeting to today, following our earnings call, as we are announcing significant actions to reduce our costs. We plan to deliver $10 billion in

cost savings

in 2025, and this includes reducing our head count by roughly 15,000 roles, or 15% of our workforce. The majority of these actions will be completed by the end of this year.

This is painful news for me to share. I know it will be even more difficult for you to read. This is an incredibly hard day for Intel as we are making some of the most consequential changes in our company’s history. When we meet in a few hours, I’ll talk about why we’re doing this and what you can expect in the coming weeks. In advance of that, I wanted to preview some of what’s on my mind.

Simply put, we must align our cost structure with our new operating model and fundamentally change the way we operate. Our revenues have not grown as expected – and we’ve yet to fully benefit from powerful trends, like AI. Our costs are too high, our margins are too low. We need bolder actions to address both – particularly given our financial results and outlook for the second half of 2024, which is tougher than previously expected.

These decisions have challenged me to my core, and this is the hardest thing I’ve done in my career. My pledge to you is that we will prioritize a culture of honesty, transparency and respect in the weeks and months to come.

Next week, we’ll announce a companywide enhanced retirement offering for eligible employees and broadly offer an application program for voluntary departures. I believe that how we implement these changes is just as important as the changes themselves, and we will adhere to Intel values throughout this process.

Why Now?

Since introducing our new operating model, we have taken a clean-sheet view of the business and assessed ourselves against benchmarks for high-performing foundries, fabless product companies and corporate functions. This work made it clear our cost structure is not competitive.

For example, our annual revenue in 2020 was about $24 billion higher than it was last year, yet our current workforce is actually 10% larger now than it was then. There are a lot of reasons for this, but it’s not a sustainable path forward.

Beyond our costs, we need to change the way we operate – something many of you shared as part of our Employee Experience Survey. There’s too much complexity, so we need to both automate and simplify processes. It takes too long for decisions to be made, so we need to eliminate bureaucracy. And there’s too much inefficiency in the system, so we need to expedite workflows.

Key Priorities

The actions we are taking will make Intel a leaner, simpler and more agile company. Let me highlight our areas of focus:

Reducing Operational Costs: We will drive companywide operational and cost efficiencies, including the cost savings and head count reductions mentioned above.

Simplifying Our Portfolio: We will complete actions this month to simplify our businesses. Each business unit is conducting a portfolio review and identifying underperforming products. We are also integrating key software assets into our business units so we accelerate our shift to systems-based solutions. And we will narrow our incubation focus on fewer, more impactful projects.

Eliminating Complexity: We will reduce layers, eliminate overlapping areas of responsibility, stop non-essential work, and foster a culture of greater ownership and accountability. For example, we will consolidate Customer Success into the Sales, Marketing and Communications Group to streamline our go-to-market motions.

Reducing Capital and Other Costs: With the completion of our historic five-nodes-in-four-years roadmap clearly in sight, we will review all active projects and equipment so we begin to shift our focus toward capital efficiency and more normalized spending levels. This will reduce our 2024 capital expenditures by more than 20%, and we plan to reduce our non-variable cost of goods sold by roughly $1 billion in 2025.

Suspending Our Dividend: We will suspend our stock dividend beginning next quarter to prioritize investments in the business and drive more sustained profitability.

Maintaining Growth Investments: Our IDM2.0 strategy is unchanged. Having fought hard to reestablish our innovation engine, we will maintain the key investments in our process technology and core product leadership.

The Future

I have no illusions that the path in front of us will be easy. You shouldn’t either. This is a tough day for all of us and there will be more tough days ahead. But as difficult as all of this is, we are making the changes necessary to build on our progress and usher in a new era of growth.

When we began this journey, we set our sights high, knowing that Intel is a place where big ideas are born and the power of what’s possible triumphs over the status quo. After all, our mission is to create world-changing technologies that improve the lives of every person on the planet. And at our best, we have exemplified these ideals more than any company in the world.

To live up to this mission, we must continue to drive our IDM 2.0 strategy, which remains the same: re-establish process technology leadership; invest in at-scale, globally resilient supply chain by expanding manufacturing capacity in the U.S. and EU; become a world-class, leading-edge foundry for internal and external customers; rebuild product portfolio leadership; and deliver AI Everywhere.

Over the past few years, we have rebuilt a sustainable innovation engine that is largely in place and on track. It’s now time to focus on building the sustainable financial engine needed to drive our performance. We must improve our execution, adapt to new market realities and operate as a more agile company. That’s the spirit of the actions we are taking – knowing that the choices we make today, as difficult as they are, will strengthen our ability to serve our customers and grow our business for years to come.

As we take these next steps in our journey, let’s not forget that there has never been a greater need for what we do. The world will increasingly run on silicon – and the world needs a healthy and vibrant Intel. That’s why the work we are doing is so consequential. Not only are we remaking a great company, but we are also creating technology and manufacturing capabilities that will reshape the world for decades to come. And this is something we should never lose sight of as we push forward in pursuit of our goals.

We’ll talk more in a few hours. Please come with your questions so we can have an open and honest discussion about what comes next.

Intel has announced to reduce its head count by more than 15% of its workforce, some 15,000 people, to reduce costs. “Our costs are too high, our margins are too low,” the company’s CEO Pat Gelsinger said in an internal memo sent to Intel employees on Thursday. In the letter, Gelsinger also said that the software giant will also announce a companywide enhanced retirement offering for eligible employees and broadly offer an application program for voluntary departures next week.
Article Summary: CEO: We plan to deliver $10 billion in cost savings by 2025. This includes reducing our head count by roughly 15,000 roles, or 15% of our workforce. The majority of these actions will be completed by the end of this year.

Article Title: iQoo Z9s series to launch in India on August 21: What to expect
Article Text:
iQoo Z9s series what to expect

iQoo Z9 Lite launched in India recently



iQoo is all set to launch its Z9s smartphone series in India on August 21. The company took to microblogging site X (formerly twitter ) to announce the launch date.“Introducing the #iQOOZ9sPro with the Z series' first-ever premium marble texture! Launching on August 21st @amazonIN. Inspired by nature and crafted for luxury. It’s not just a phone—it’s a statement of style and performance,” read the company’s post.As per the teaser, the upcoming smartphone series is claimed to be the ‘segment’s fastest curved screen phone’.The series may offer two phones – iQoo Z9s and iQoo Z9s Pro .The upcoming iQoo smartphone series is tipped to come in 12GB RAM and 256GB internal storage variant. The smartphone may feature a 50MP rear camera with f/1.8 aperture and OIS. white and orange are the rumoured colour variants of the phones, but it is likely that the series may offer other colour models as well.Chinese smartphone maker iQoo launched its Z9 Lite smartphone in India last week. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 10,499. iQoo Z9 Lite 5G sports a 6.56-inch HD+ display and is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with up to 6GB of RAM. The smartphone offers 128GB internal storage. Users can further expand the storage by adding a microSD card of up to 1TB.iQoo Z9 Lite 5G runs Android 14 operating system topped with FunTouch OS. The smartphone also comes with IP64 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The smartphone is backed by a 5000 mAh battery with 15W fast charging support.
Article Summary: iQoo is all set to launch its Z9s smartphone series in India on August 21. The company took to microblogging site X (formerly twitter ) to announce the launch date. iQoo Z9 Lite was launched in India last week with a starting price tag of Rs 10,499.

Article Title: 'ATM, UPI service affected': Ransomware attack on service provider hits 300 small banks across India
Article Text:
All online transactions, such as RTGS and UPI payments, affected

'Breach discovered two days ago'

NEW DELHI: A ransomware attack has forced the temporary shutdown of payment systems across nearly 300 small Indian local banks, according to reports. The customers of these banks have not been able to access payments services like withdrawing cash at ATMs or using United Payments Interface (UPI).The ransomware attack affected C-Edge Technologies , a provider of banking technology systems to small banks across the country, reports said.Other banking services are functioning normally, the officials told PTI.In a statement released late in the evening, the national payments corporation of India (NPCI) said, "C-Edge Technologies….has been possibly impacted by a ransomware attack impacting a few of their systems," leading to the temporary isolation of C-Edge from accessing NPCI-operated retail payment systems.Dileep Sanghani, chairman of the national cooperative union of India, told news agency PTI that nearly 300 banks in India, including 17 district cooperative banks in Gujarat, which rely on C-Edge, have been facing issues for the past two to three days."All online transactions, such as RTGS and UPI payments, are affected. Money is deducted from the sender's account but does not get credited in the receiver's account," Sanghani said."Customers of banks serviced by C-Edge will not be able to access payment systems during the period of isolation," the NPCI told news agency Reuters.The statement also mentioned that restoration work is being carried out rapidly in collaboration with C-Edge Technologies, and a mandatory security review is underway.C-Edge, a joint venture between SBI and TCS, serves cooperative banks and regional rural banks, which have been affected by the breach. Officials stated that other banking services remained unaffected. To protect the broader payments system, necessary precautions, including isolating the C-Edge system, had to be implemented following the discovery of the breach two days ago.An industry official told news agency PTI that a ransomware had been detected and isolated within the system, prompting a third-party audit.The official told news agency PTI that the affected banks represent less than 1 percent of the total payment system volume in the country.Despite the incident, no financial losses have been reported, news agency PTI said.
Article Summary: Customers of these banks have not been able to access payments services like withdrawing cash at ATMs or using United Payments Interface (UPI) The ransomware attack affected C-Edge Technologies, a provider of banking technology systems to small banks across the country.

Article Title: Anand Mahindra on Indian badminton star Lakshya Sen's match at Paris Olympic: If I was his opponent, I would …
Article Text:
What Anand Mahindra said

Indian badminton sensation Lakshya Sen has left the sporting world in awe with his remarkable performance at the Paris Olympics 2024. In a thrilling match against Indonesia’s world number 4 Jonatan Christie , Lakshya not only secured a convincing 21-18, 21-12 victory but also showcased an extraordinary shot that went viral on social media .Mahindra Group chairman Anand Mahindra has once again showcased his sharp wit, this time taking a playful jab at Lakshya Sen's audacious behind-the-back shot.The shot in question? A jaw-dropping “behind-the-back” stroke that left spectators and opponents alike stunned. Industrialist Anand Mahindra, witnessing this display of skill, humorously suggested that Christie’s only recourse might be to “cry foul and file a suit” against Lakshya. According to Mahindra, the young shuttler seemed like an “unnatural opponent who possessed three arms.”The post resonated with fans, garnering thousands of likes and retweets. Here are some of the user reactions .“I was fortunate enough to watch this live. This is new India. Unconventional, aggressive, energetic and resourceful.”“Absolutely. A secret weapon of the best players! The Trump Card.”“Amazing. I can’t stand on my feet for 10 mins straight, and how do these athlete fly on toes.”“Flick that will be remembered for ages !”
Article Summary: Indian badminton sensation Lakshya Sen has left the sporting world in awe with his remarkable performance at the Paris Olympics 2024. In a thrilling match against Indonesia’s world number 4 Jonatan Christie, Lakshya secured a convincing 21-18, 21-12 victory. The shot in question? A jaw-dropping “behind- the-back” stroke that left spectators and opponents alike stunned.

Article Title: Google to Tesla CEO Elon Musk: We want to set this record straight ...
Article Text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk accused Google of interfering with US elections and banning Donald Trump on Search. Google responded, clarifying that a bug in its autocomplete feature affected searches for political figures, including past presidents. The company stated that the issue has been resolved and emphasized that autocomplete helps users find results quickly without censoring specific terms.
Article Summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk accused Google of interfering with US elections and banning Donald Trump on Search. Google responded, clarifying that a bug in its autocomplete feature affected searches for political figures, including past presidents. The company stated that the issue has been resolved.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 15 Plus is available for just Rs 16,730 on Amazon; check exchange deal and bank offer
Article Text:
Apple iPhone 15 Plus (Black, 128GB) Amazon deal

iPhone 15 Plus specifications

Display: The iPhone 15 Plus boasts a 6.7-inch Super Retina XDR display with ProMotion technology, allowing for a refresh rate of up to 120Hz. This provides a smoother and more responsive visual experience.

Processor: It is powered by the latest A16 Bionic chip, which ensures high performance and efficiency for demanding tasks.

Camera: The rear camera system features a new 48MP main sensor, offering significant improvements in photo and video quality, especially in low light. The Ultra Wide and Telephoto cameras have also seen enhancements, expanding shooting options.

Battery and additional features: The iPhone 15 Plus includes a long-lasting battery, a new under-display fingerprint sensor, and a USB-C port for added convenience.

Article Title: Turkey's Olympic shooter Yusuf Dikec breaks the internet with effortless swag; he’s the hottest meme on X
Article Text:
Yusuf Dikec’s viral moment

Comparisons and memes



Yusuf Dikec memes and reactions on X

Olympic 2024 results

Also read

Turkish air pistol shooter Yusuf Dikec has become a viral sensation on social media after winning the silver medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. A photograph of the 51-year-old athlete taking aim with one hand in his pocket and minimal gear has captivated the internet. This unexpected image of casual confidence has made Dikec the hottest meme on X, garnering widespread attention and admiration.On X, a post featuring the now-iconic photograph of Dikec has amassed an astonishing 62 million views.The post humorously noted, “Turkey sent a 51 yr old guy with no specialised lenses, eye cover or ear protection and got the silver medal,” capturing the essence of Dikec's unconventional approach.Dikec's appearance and performance starkly contrasted with other athletes in the air pistol mixed team competition, who sported specialised gear, including goggles, lenses to prevent blur, and noise-cancelling ear protectors. In contrast, Dikec competed with prescription glasses and normal earplugs, exuding an aura of casual coolness as he competed with one hand in his pocket. This unique display of confidence and skill has led to a flood of memes and jokes on X and other social media platforms.Social media users have had a field day with Dikec's image. Some of the best memes include comparisons to a secret spy or hitman, humorously suggesting that he intentionally didn't win gold to avoid suspicion. Here are some notable posts:In the 10-metre air pistol mixed team event, Zorana Arunovic and Damir Mikec of Serbia won the gold, narrowly defeating Sevval Ilayda Tarhan and Yusuf Dikec of Turkey with a score of 16-14 at the Chateauroux Shooting Centre. India’s Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh claimed the bronze, beating the South Korean pair Oh Ye-jin and Lee Won-ho 16-10.
Article Summary: Turkish air pistol shooter Yusuf Dikec has become a viral sensation on social media after winning the silver medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. A photograph of the 51-year-old athlete taking aim with one hand in his pocket and minimal gear has captivated the internet. This unexpected image of casual confidence has made him the hottest meme on X.

Article Title: 30% of Gen-AI projects will be 'dumped' by the end of 2025 due to these reasons: Gartner
Article Text:
What early adopters say

Calculating business impact

At least 30% of generative artificial intelligence ( GenAI ) projects will be abandoned after proof of concept by the end of 2025, due to poor data quality, inadequate risk controls, escalating costs or unclear business value, according to research company Gartner , Inc.Speaking at the Gartner Data & Analytics Summit in Sydney this week, Rita Sallam, distinguished VP analyst at Gartner said, “After last year's hype, executives are impatient to see returns on GenAI investments, yet organizations are struggling to prove and realize value.As the scope of initiatives widen, the financial burden of developing and deploying GenAI models is increasingly felt.”A major challenge for organizations arises in justifying the substantial investment in GenAI for productivity enhancement, which can be difficult to directly translate into financial benefit, according to Gartner. Many organizations are leveraging GenAI to transform their business models and create new business opportunities. However, these deployment approaches come with significant costs, ranging from $5 million to $20 million.“Unfortunately, there is no one size fits all with GenAI, and costs aren’t as predictable as other technologies,” said Sallam. “What you spend, the use cases you invest in and the deployment approaches you take, all determine the costs. Whether you’re a market disruptor and want to infuse AI everywhere, or you have a more conservative focus on productivity gains or extending existing processes, each has different levels of cost, risk, variability and strategic impact.”Regardless of AI ambition, Gartner research indicates GenAI requires a higher tolerance for indirect, future financial investment criteria versus immediate return on investment (ROI). Historically, many CFOs have not been comfortable with investing today for indirect value in the future. This reluctance can skew investment allocation to tactical versus strategic outcomes.Earlier adopters across industries and business processes are reporting a range of business improvements that vary by use case, job type and skill level of the worker. According to a recent Gartner survey, respondents reported 15.8% revenue increase, 15.2% cost savings and 22.6% productivity improvement on average. The survey of 822 business leaders was conducted between September and November 2023.“This data serves as a valuable reference point for assessing the business value derived from GenAI business model innovation,” said Sallam. “But it’s important to acknowledge the challenges in estimating that value, as benefits are very company, use case, role and workforce specific. Often, the impact may not be immediately evident and may materialize over time. However, this delay doesn’t diminish the potential benefits.”By analyzing the business value and the total costs of GenAI business model innovation, organizations can establish the direct ROI and future value impact, according to Gartner. This serves as a crucial tool for making informed investment decisions about GenAI business model innovation.“If the business outcomes meet or exceed expectations, it presents an opportunity to expand investments by scaling GenAI innovation and usage across a broader user base, or implementing it in additional business divisions,” said Sallam. “However, if they fall short, it may be necessary to explore alternative innovation scenarios. These insights help organizations strategically allocate resources and determine the most effective path forward.”
Article Summary: At least 30% of generative artificial intelligence projects will be abandoned after proof of concept by the end of 2025, according to research company Gartner. Many organizations are leveraging GenAI to transform their business models and create new business opportunities. But these deployment approaches come with significant costs, ranging from $5 million to $20 million.

How to use Indian Bike Driving 3D Cheat Codes

Begin by starting the Indian Bike Driving 3D game on your device.

Look for the button featuring a phone icon, typically located at the bottom left corner of the game screen. Click on this icon to open the phone menu.

Within the phone menu, find the handset icon, usually coloured green and positioned in the middle. Click on this icon to proceed.

Upon clicking the handset icon, a contact list will appear on the screen. Look for an icon featuring nine orange circles at the bottom left corner of this screen. Click on it to access the number entry interface.

In the number entry interface, use your device's keypad to input one of the provided cheat codes. Each cheat code corresponds to a specific reward mentioned in the description.

After entering the cheat code, press the confirm or enter button on your device's keypad. This action will immediately grant you the corresponding benefit associated with that cheat code.

Article Title: Oppo K12x 5G debut in India with MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor and 32MP camera: Price and other details
Article Text:
Oppo K12x 5G price and availability

Oppo K12x 5G features

Oppo took the wraps off its K12x 5G phone in India today. The smartphone comes with a starting price of Rs 12,999 and is claimed to be the toughest phone under Rs 15K. It comes with a 360-degree damage-proof armour body. Powered by a MediaTek chip, the device has a 5,100mAh battery with 45W SuperVOOC charger. Here are the detailsOppo K12x 5G has two RAM variants - 6GB and 8GB paired with 128GB and 256GB storage capacities.The 6GB RAM model costs Rs 12,999, while the 8GB RAM model is priced at Rs 15,999. The handset will be available in the country via Flipkart along with Oppo online stores and offline retail stores across the country.First sale of Oppo K12x 5G starts August 2 at 12 noon. Breeze Blue and Midnight Violet are the colour options that buyers can choose from.As far as the features are concerned, Oppo K12x 5G has a 6.67-inch 120Hz Ultra Bright display with 1000 nits of peak brightness. The smartphone has a 7.68 mm slim casing and weighs about 186 grams.The handset is said to have a 360° damage-proof armour body and comes with military standard certified - IP54 water and dust resistance design. Oppo K12x 5G houses a 5,100mAh battery and comes with 45 W SUPERVOOC Flash Charge.The Oppo K12x 5G smartphone comes powered by MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset based on 6nm architecture. It offers up to 8GB RAM expansion. On the camera front, the smartphone boasts of a 32MP AI main camera with 2MP secondary camera. For selfies and video calls, the phone has an 8MP camera at the front.
Article Summary: Oppo took the wraps off its K12x 5G phone in India today. The smartphone comes with a starting price of Rs 12,999 and is claimed to be the toughest phone under Rs 15K. Powered by a MediaTek chip, the device has a 5,100mAh battery with 45W SuperVOOC charger.

Article Title: Lost money through UPI, credit/debit cards, or ATM scams? Stay calm and follow these steps
Article Text:
UPI or ATM scam victim? Immediate actions to take

Report the fraud immediately

Block your card or UPI account

File a complaint with your bank

Lodge a complaint with the Cyber Crime Cell

File an FIR

UPI and ATM frauds: Tracking and recovering your funds

Follow up with your bank

Use the dispute resolution mechanism

Leverage the Ombudsman scheme

UPI and ATM scams: Preventive measures for the future

Enable transaction alerts

Set transaction limits

Use two-factor authentication

Regularly monitor your statements

Be wary of phishing scams

Also read

In the digital age, financial transactions have become incredibly convenient. The rise of Unified Payments Interface (UPI), credit/debit cards, and ATMs has revolutionised the way we manage our finances. However, with these advancements comes an increase in financial scams. Many individuals fall prey to fraudulent activities, losing hard-earned money in the process.If you have experienced such a situation, it is essential to remain calm and take immediate action. This guide outlines the crucial steps to follow if you lose money via UPI, credit/debit cards, or ATM scams , helping you secure your finances and increase the chances of recovery.As soon as you detect any unauthorised transaction, contact your bank or card issuer immediately. Most financial institutions have dedicated helplines for reporting fraud. Time is critical in these situations; the sooner you report, the better the chances of freezing the fraudulent transaction. Provide all necessary details, including the transaction amount, time, and any relevant information that can assist in the investigation.To prevent further unauthorised transactions, request your bank to block your card or freeze your UPI account. This step is vital in minimising the potential damage to your finances. Most banks offer this service through their customer service numbers or mobile apps. Additionally, changing your online banking passwords and securing your accounts is advisable.Visit your bank's nearest branch or use their online complaint system to file a detailed report about the fraud. Ensure you include all pertinent information, such as transaction details and any correspondence with the fraudsters. This documentation is essential for the bank's investigation and potential reimbursement.Reporting the fraud to the Cyber Crime Cell in your city is crucial. You can submit a complaint online via the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal at cybercrime.gov.in. Provide comprehensive details and any evidence you have to support your claim. Cybercrime cells are equipped to handle such cases and can coordinate with banks and other institutions to track the fraudsters.If the amount lost is substantial, filing a First Information Report (FIR) at your local police station is necessary. This legal step initiates a formal investigation, which is often required for any reimbursement claims from your bank. Make sure to include all required documents and detailed information about the scam.Stay in constant contact with your bank during the investigation. Banks usually require up to 10 business days to investigate fraud cases. Keeping a record of all communications and following up regularly can expedite the process and ensure your case is prioritised.Banks and payment platforms have dispute resolution mechanisms in place. If the transaction was unauthorised, file a dispute with your bank. The bank might provisionally credit the disputed amount back to your account while the investigation is ongoing. Providing detailed information and documentation can help your case.If your bank's response is unsatisfactory, you can escalate the issue to the Banking Ombudsman. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) offers this service to address grievances related to banking services. Filing a complaint with the Ombudsman can bring additional scrutiny and pressure on the bank to resolve your issue.Activate SMS and email alerts for all transactions on your bank accounts and cards. This feature allows you to detect unauthorised activity immediately and take swift action to prevent further fraud.Setting daily or per-transaction limits on your cards and UPI accounts can minimise potential losses if your account is compromised. Most banks offer this service through their mobile apps or online banking platforms.Two-factor authentication (2FA) enhances the security of your online transactions by adding an additional layer of protection. Enabling 2FA makes it harder for fraudsters to access your accounts, even if they have your password.Reviewing your bank and card statements regularly helps spot unauthorised transactions early. Immediate detection can prevent further fraud and make it easier to recover lost funds.Be cautious of unsolicited emails, messages, or phone calls asking for your banking details. Always confirm the legitimacy of such communications before replying. Banks and financial institutions will never request sensitive information through these methods.
Article Summary: The rise of Unified Payments Interface (UPI) and credit/debit cards has revolutionised the way we manage our finances. However, with these advancements comes an increase in financial scams. This guide outlines the crucial steps to follow if you lose money via UPI, credit/Debit cards, or ATM scams.

Article Title: Oppo A3x 5G launches in India with 32MP camera and 5,100mAh battery: Price and other details
Article Text:
Oppo A3x price and availability



Oppo A3x 5G features

Oppo has launched a new smartphone under its A series. The company has launched Oppo A3x 5G phone in India. Priced under Rs 15,000, Oppo A3x 5G comes powered by a MediaTek processor and boasts of a 5,100mAh battery. Here's everything you need to know about the new Oppo phoneOppo A3x is offered in two storage models - 64GB and 128GB paired with 4GB RAM. The former costs Rs 12,499, while the 128GB variant is priced at Rs 13,499.Starry Purple, Sparkle Black, and Starlight White are the colour variants of the smartphone.It is available on Oppo online store along with offline retail stores across the country.Oppo A3x 5G is equipped with a 6.67-inch HD+ display with 120Hz refresh rate, 1000 nits peak brightness and 89.9% screen-to-body ratio. Powering the phone is the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor paired with 4GB RAM.Oppo A3x 5G comes with military-grade shock resistance against accidental drops and spills. As far as the camera is concerned, the handset boasts of a 32MP (8MP pixel-binned) primary camera. For selfies and video calls, the device has a 5MP camera at the front.The device houses a 5,100mAh battery coupled with 45watt SuperVOOC Flash Charge. G, 4G LTE, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and a USB Type-C port are some of the connectivity features on the Oppo A3x 5G. The smartphone runs on ColorOS 14.0 operating system.
Article Summary: Oppo has launched a new smartphone under its A series. The company has launched Oppo A3x 5G phone in India. Priced under Rs 15,000, the phone comes powered by a MediaTek processor. It is available on Oppo online store along with offline retail stores.

Article Title: Google Pixel 9 series’ Tensor G4 chip may not get major upgrades
Article Text: Google 's upcoming Pixel 9 series, set to launch on August 13, will feature the new Tensor G4 chip . While the overall upgrade may be modest, the chip's improved modem could significantly enhance user experience, according to recent reports.The Tensor G4, as revealed by Android Authority, maintains many components from its predecessor but introduces a new CPU configuration and an upgraded modem.The chip adopts a 1+3+4 core layout, featuring newer ARMv9.2 cores: one Cortex-X4, three Cortex-A720, and four Cortex-A520. These cores are clocked slightly higher than those in the Tensor G3 .The most notable improvement comes from the Exynos Modem 5400 , which reportedly offers up to 50% better power consumption compared to the previous Exynos Modem 5300. This enhancement could address long-standing issues of heat generation and battery drain in Pixel devices, particularly when using cellular data.Android Authority's source indicates that the Tensor G4 retains many custom components from the G3, including the Titan M2 security chip and the TPU (Tensor Processing Unit). The chip's packaging process reportedly remains unchanged, using Samsung 's FOPLP (Fan-Out Panel Level Packaging) technology.Interestingly, the report mentions that not all Tensor G4 devices may benefit from the new modem. A future device, possibly the Pixel 9a , might use the older Exynos Modem 5300 instead.
Article Summary: Google's upcoming Pixel 9 series will feature the new Tensor G4 chip. The chip features a new CPU configuration and an upgraded modem. The modem reportedly offers up to 50% better power consumption compared to the previous Exynos Modem 5300.
